intro: Cyrtandra rotumaensis, commonly known as the Rotuma heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rotuma in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
